definition-item.definition-title: BROADCAST COMMUNICATION (multiplex communication H04J; pictorial communication aspects of broadcast systems H04N)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: arrangements for broadcast or for distribution combined with broadcast;
arrangements specially adapted for receiving broadcast information;
arrangements for broadcast applications with a direct linkage to broadcast information or to broadcast space-time; broadcast-related systems.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pictorial communication aspects in broadcast systems

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: simultaneous distribution of identical signals to plural receiving stations. The term "broadcast" does not include distribution to receiving stations which is controlled by requests or responses from the receiving stations
all kinds of information distributed by broadcast systems, e.g. broadcast programme
information required by services provided via broadcast systems, other than broadcast information
a time when particular broadcast information exists and is available
a channel via which broadcast information is distributed, e.g. carrier waves, time slots, cables or wireless broadcast service areas
either a set of broadcast channels in which particular broadcast information exists and is available or a geographical area determined by the set of broadcast channels
space-time determined by broadcast space and broadcast time in which particular broadcast information exists and is available
a system which consists of transmitter, transponder and receiver for broadcast
a system which is directly affected by generation, broadcast, reception or use of broadcast information
a service provided by a broadcast system, i.e. distribution service of broadcast information
a service directly provided by broadcast-related systems
"A with a direct linkage to B"
"A directly affects B" or "A is directly affected by B"

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for services using the result of monitoring, identification or recognition covered by groups H04H60/29-H04H60/54

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Technical subjects which are covered by H04H60/29 or H04H60/35, and are more strongly focused on a use of monitoring, identification or recognition outcome than its process, e.g. an integrated system which consists of (1) a broadcast reception subsystem which receives a broadcast music programme, and monitors broadcast time and a broadcast channel to which a user is tuning in, (2) a broadcast related information retrieving subsystem which firstly identifies numbers a user has listened to by looking up a broadcast database with the broadcast time and the broadcast channel, and secondly identifies compact discs which include the numbers by searching a compact disc information database, and (3) a online compact disc sales subsystem for selling the compact discs which include the numbers to the user over the Internet.
The technical subject covered by this group could also be classified to one of the groups (H04H60/29 or H04H60/35) to clarify the object of monitoring, identification or recognition.
